title: Engineering Firm Warned of Systemic Issue With Miami-Area Condo Building Before Deadly Collapse
summary: Another report from the same firm gave the building top grades on several measures. An engineering firm in 2018 warned the condo association of Champlain Towers South, the Miami-area building that partially collapsed this week, that there was a "major error" in its design that allowed water to pool near its base.

title: Microsoft Discloses Customer Hack Tied to SolarWinds Cyberattackers
summary: Hackers previously linked to Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service were behind recent attack on a customer support system, the company says. Microsoft Corp. said hackers, linked by U.S. authorities to Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service, installed malicious information-stealing software on one of its systems and used information gleaned there to attack its customers.

title: Biden Walks Back Threat on Bipartisan Infrastructure Deal
summary: President, facing backlash from Republicans, says he is committed to bipartisan bill he earlier said he wouldn't sign unless broader bill opposed by GOP also gets passed. WASHINGTON-President Biden walked back comments tying the fate of a roughly $1 trillion bipartisan infrastructure agreement to a separate, Democratic effort to pass a broad antipoverty plan, recommitting to the bipartisan deal after Republicans threatened to withdraw their support.

title: U.K. Health Secretary Quits Over Breach of Social-Distance Guidelines With Aide
summary: Matt Hancock's resignation comes as the country grapples with surging Covid-19 cases caused by Delta variant. LONDON-U.K. Health Secretary Matt Hancock resigned, causing disruption at the top of the government's pandemic response as Britain grapples with an upswing in Covid-19 cases caused by the Delta variant.

title: Tesla Addresses Safety Issue in More Than 285,000 Vehicles in China
summary: Software update is issued to address safety risks posed by the vehicles' cruise-control system, which could be accidentally activated. Tesla Inc. is addressing a safety issue in more than 285,000 passenger vehicles in China-including more than 90% of locally made vehicles sold by the company-associated with their cruise-control system, the country's market regulator said.

title: Discoveries of Canada Burial Sites Stir Painful Memories for Indigenous People
summary: Resume Subscription. SIX NATIONS OF THE GRAND RIVER TERRITORY, Ontario-When 215 unmarked graves were found near a former boarding school for Indigenous children last month, Sherlene Bomberry said she was overwhelmed by the memory of hearing little girls crying in their beds and fearsome punishments during her time at the same type of school in the 1960s.

title: Johnson & Johnson Settles New York Opioid Case for $230 Million
summary: The deal comes as talks intensify to clinch a $26 billion resolution of thousands of other opioid lawsuits. Johnson & Johnson has agreed to pay $230 million to the state of New York to resolve an opioid lawsuit slated to go to trial Tuesday, as negotiations intensify with the company and three drug distributors to clinch a $26 billion settlement of thousands of other lawsuits blaming the pharmaceutical industry for the opioid crisis.

title: What I'll Remember Most About My Pandemic Year: A Teen Time Capsule
summary: Resume Subscription. This past year has had a particularly profound impact on teenagers: Many of the formative experiences that shape this special and often confusing time of life-prom, graduation, senior ditch day-disappeared, or were poorly replaced by virtual stand-ins. What did teens learn about themselves during this remarkable period in human history? And what single experience, object or discovery would they want their future selves to remember about their Covid year?

title: The Bike Racer Riding the Tour de France on His Own
summary: EF Education-Nippo's Lachlan Morton plans to cover all 21 stages-and the hundreds of miles in between them-without team support. In the hours after the Tour de France peloton sets off from Brittany on Saturday, pro cyclist Lachlan Morton will hop on his bike and start pedaling on the same route, far behind teammates that he won't see again for three weeks.

title: CEOs Ignore Social Issues at Their Own Peril
summary: Leaders are more likely to be fired for riling shareholders about social, rather than financial, concerns, a new study suggests. CEOs of major U.S. companies have reason to be worried about growing shareholder unrest on a range of social issues.

title: With Covid-19 Easing, Diplomats Urge Biden to Lift Ban on European Travelers
summary: 'We raise this in every official meeting'; Biden administration has offered no plan to reopen borders. WASHINGTON-European diplomats and business groups are urging President Biden to lift the 15-month-old ban on travel from Europe and the United Kingdom after both began accepting American travelers, saying the lack of reciprocation hinders economic recovery and separates families.

title: Denmark Expanding 'Ghetto' Housing Policy That Drew Accusations of Racism
summary: Resume Subscription. For 26 years, Asif Mehmood has lived in a public-housing project in a Copenhagen neighborhood that has a large population of immigrants and second-generation Danes.

title: Sydney Expands Covid-19 Lockdown to Halt Delta Variant
summary: Australia's largest city and the surrounding areas will be under lockdown for two weeks to help stamp out the latest coronavirus outbreak. SYDNEY-Sydney and surrounding areas will go into lockdown for two weeks as officials widen existing restrictions in an effort to halt the spread of the highly infectious coronavirus Delta variant across Australia's largest city.

title: The Latest Maternity Wear Trend? Crop Tops
summary: Influencers and celebrities like Nicki Minaj, Emily Rajatkowski and Ilana Glazer are celebrating their pregnancies by wearing looks that expose their expectant bellies. Off Brand is a column that delves into trends in fashion and beauty.

title: 'Nikolai Astrup: Visions of Norway' Review: Green Territory
summary: More than nine decades after his death, the painter and printmaker makes his North American debut in a retrospective at the Clark Art Institute, where his luscious landscapes beguile.. Williamstown, Mass.

title: Venmo to Charge Users for Selling Goods and Services
summary: Payments app says it will allow use of personal accounts for business transactions as of July 20. Venmo, the payments app owned by PayPal Holdings Inc., will soon allow users to sell products and services on their personal accounts, for a fee.

title: Five Exercises to Boost Speed and Agility
summary: Resume Subscription. Lacrosse is a physically intense sport that requires players to use netted sticks to scoop up, carry and shoot a ball into a goal, all while evading opponents.

title: Housing Market Booms, but Small Contractors Miss Out
summary: Resume Subscription. Some small contractors say they are missing out on the U.S. housing boom as shortages of workers and supplies in hot markets result in project cancellations or business lost to bigger players.

title: Cleaned-Up Vatican Bank Works to Justify Its Existence
summary: Pope's bank, after years of overhauls to prevent money-laundering, now seeks to win and keep customers. VATICAN CITY-The long scandal-tainted Vatican bank has been overhauled over the last decade to ward off tax evaders and money launderers. Now it must convince legitimate customers, inside the Vatican and out, that it has something to offer them.

title: New York and Other Northeast States See Large Drop in Unemployment
summary: Rising vaccination rates and business reopenings are driving labor-market gains in a region hit hard by the pandemic. The labor-market recovery picked up momentum this spring in the Northeast, with New York, Connecticut and other nearby states posting sizable drops in unemployment last month.

title: Bitcoin Slumps Toward Another 'Crypto Winter'
summary: Digital currency's latest selloff points to possible period of flat trading. New bitcoin investors felt the thrill of the digital currency's most recent epic rally. Now, they are experiencing the other side of that ride.

title: Remote Work Is the New Signing Bonus
summary: Workers are trading jobs, enticed by the guarantee of flexible schedules and continued work from home. After almost a year and a half of working from home, many white-collar employees say they are not willing to return to corporate offices full-time. Even whispers of returning have been enough to send some professionals searching for an exit-and plenty of bosses are welcoming them to new jobs with the promise they can work remotely, at least most of the time.

title: The Pandemic Made Our Relationships Stronger
summary: Despite early fears of a divorce surge, new data shows that after a difficult year couples are more appreciative and committed. During the pandemic, it felt like everything changed for the worse. But one thing got better: our relationships.

title: How AI Is Taking Over Our Gadgets
summary: AI is moving from data centers to devices, making everything from phones to tractors faster and more private. These newfound smarts also come with pitfalls.. If you think of AI as something futuristic and abstract, start thinking different.

title: Why Apple, Amazon and Spotify Are Embracing Hi-Def Music: A Guide to 'Lossless' Streaming
summary: Answers to 10 burning questions on hi-def streaming-from how it's vastly improving sound quality to how to access it. Plus: The best gear to take advantage of the revolution both at home and on the go.. EMILY LAZAR knows better than most how great music can sound. At her New York mastering studio, the Lodge, the Grammy-winning engineer puts the finishing touches on songs by the likes of the Foo Fighters, Haim and the Rolling Stones. Her job is to ensure that every harmony, cymbal crash and power chord sounds exactly as the artists intended them to when their albums go out into the world.

title: Derek Chauvin Sentenced to 22.5 Years for Murder of George Floyd
summary: Judge said his decision was based on the law, not emotion or public opinion, and considered what he called Chauvin's egregious abuse of authority and cruelty. MINNEAPOLIS-Former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin was sentenced Friday to 22 years and six months for the murder of George Floyd, closing out a chapter in a case that redefined the conversation over race and policing in the U.S.

title: 159 Missing, 4 Confirmed Dead in Florida Condo Collapse
summary: Resume Subscription. SURFSIDE, Fla.-Search and rescue crews worked through dangerous conditions Friday, searching for as many as 159 people who are unaccounted for after the collapse of a condo tower that killed at least four people.

title: Biden Signs Law Creating Memorial at Nightclub Shooting Site
summary: President is joined by survivors of the attack, in which 49 people were killed and dozens more injured by a gunman in 2016. WASHINGTON-President Biden signed legislation creating a national memorial at the site of a gay nightclub in Orlando, Fla., where 49 people were killed and dozens more injured by a gunman in 2016.
